医学新闻来自 News-Medical.Net - 来自世界各地的最新医学新闻和研究https://www.news-medical.net/ en-GB
青少年体育参与与老年时期较高的骨矿物质密度相关随着年龄的增长，骨矿物质密度 (BMD) 下降是骨质疏松症（骨组织退化）的一个重要原因，据报道，骨质疏松症是日本老年人跌倒的主要原因之一。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Adolescent-sports-participation- Associated-with-higher-bone-mineral- Density-in-old-age.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Adolescent-sports-participation- Associated-with-higher-bone-mineral- Density-in-old-age.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=d6b722c2-89af-4567-9f02-f566d311755e Mon, 08 Jan 2024 11:11:05 -0500 Adolescent sports participation associated with higher bone mineral density in old age
身体健康可以提高你的注意力吗？更好的身体素质与更好的注意力和注意力有关。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Does-being-physically-fit-improve-your-attention-span.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Does-being-physically-fit-improve-your-attention-span.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=8391329c-9df8-485e-9edc-8c07b0257703 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 09:49:00 -0500 Does being physically fit improve your attention span?
在实验室中培育微小肿瘤以进行个性化肺癌治疗肺癌占全球每年癌症相关死亡人数的近 20%。根据瑞士癌症联盟2022年的统计数据，瑞士每年报告近5000例新发肺癌病例。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Growing-tiny-tumors-in-the-lab-for-personalized-lung-cancer-treatment.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Growing-tiny-tumors-in-the-lab-for-personalized-lung-cancer-treatment.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=1cdcde1e-0ac5-4d62-a991-b6b8a158cfe1 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 09:17:14 -0500 Growing tiny tumors in the lab for personalized lung cancer treatment
人工智能揭示癌症细胞邻域的隐藏规则费城儿童医院的研究人员开发了一种新的人工智能算法，以帮助了解不同的细胞如何组织成特定的组织并相互通信。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/AI-reveals-hidden-rules-of-cell-neighborhoods-in-cancer.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/AI-reveals-hidden-rules-of-cell-neighborhoods-in-cancer.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=c584c755-788c-47f8-a925-387d866f2358 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 08:53:51 -0500 AI reveals hidden rules of cell neighborhoods in cancer
对患者未培养细菌的基因组分析鉴定出 30 多个新物种未知细菌在医院里很常见。巴塞尔大学的研究人员花了多年时间收集和分析它们。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Genomic-analysis-of-uncultured-bacteria-from-病人-identizes-more-than-thirty-new-species.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Genomic-analysis-of-uncultured-bacteria-from-病人-identizes-more-than-thirty-new-species.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=1316e33e-ea20-4ed1-b4ab-6d8448474184 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 08:24:27 -0500 Genomic analysis of uncultured bacteria from patients identifies more than thirty new species
探索肠脑联系：饮食和营养吸收如何影响消化系统疾病肠-脑相互作用（DGBIs）的主要疾病。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Exploring-the-gut-brain-link-How-diet-and- Nutrition-absorbation-impact-digestive-disorders.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Exploring-the-gut-brain-link-How-diet-and- Nutrition-absorbation-impact-digestive-disorders.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=027f963b-4523-4793-a977-c02cc19e4421 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 08:23:00 -0500 Exploring the gut-brain link: How diet and nutrient absorption impact digestive disorders
PrEP 的自付费用不断上升，威胁着结束艾滋病毒流行的关键战略研究表明，艾滋病毒暴露前预防 (PrEP) 药物的自付费用增加，药物已被证明可以显着降低艾滋病毒感染风险，可能会导致 PrEP 使用量显着减少，艾滋病毒感染率上升。宾夕法尼亚大学佩雷​​尔曼医学院和约翰霍普金斯大学彭博公共卫生学院的研究人员共同领导的一项新研究。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Rising-out-of-pocket-costs-for-PrEP-threaten-key-strategy-in-ending-the-HIV-epidemic.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Rising-out-of-pocket-costs-for-PrEP-threaten-key-strategy-in-ending-the-HIV-epidemic.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=69a5316c-c69d-4849-becb-c0652b3e5ed9 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 08:14:45 -0500 Rising out-of-pocket costs for PrEP threaten key strategy in ending the HIV epidemic
间歇性禁食可以提高你的运动表现吗？间歇性禁食对运动表现的影响。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Does-intermittent-fasting-improve-your-sports-performance.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20240108/Does-intermittent-fasting-improve-your-sports-performance.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=b5a2ef0a-5fa1-4d0e-bbb3-d8c402569801 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 06:49:00 -0500 Does intermittent fasting improve your sports performance?
